JobListing.ShortDescription: Digger Operator required for immediate start!

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: North Shore Location- No more city traffic!
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Grow your career in Civil Construction

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Excavator/Digger Operator

• Great Pay Rates!
• Great company
• Good gear

Stellar Recruitment is your number one choice for finding the best job opportunities in the civil construction market. We are specialists in civil infrastructure, construction and mining, and recruit for opportunities in NZ, Australia and even further abroad.

We are seeking a skilled, reliable Operator, who has experience operating excavators.

This role is not for the faint hearted, it is a physically demanding role that will give you the opportunity to further develop your career in the Civil construction industry. Not only will you be operating multiple machines but you will also be assisting on the ground as and when required.

Typically building Retaining Walls on large scale Civil works projects, our ideal candidate will have experience in the following:

• Drilling with Pendulum type drill rigs
• Excavating of footings
• Bulk Backfilling
• Compaction knowledge
• Machine Maintenance abilities

In order to be considered for this role you must have:

• Current Class 2 driver’s license
• Wheels Tracks and Rollers endorsed
• Excellent verbal communication skills
• Carry out regular maintenance of plant
• Team Player
• Reliable & punctual

What’s in it for you:

• Competitive rates of pay
• Optional Vehicle, phone & fuel neg
• Training opportunities

If this sounds like you, apply online today!!

For more information on the role including duties, hours and rates of pay, contact Fern on 09 969 1028 or email your CV to fern.d@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Grader Operator- great opportunity to join a awesome team!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Grader operator


The Company

Our Auckland based company has a huge workload on over the foreseeable future and they are looking for a final trim grader operator to join their outstanding team on a permanent basis.

What we’re looking for:

  • Ideally a minimum of 10 years in the industry on a grader.
  • Strong attention to detail with a focus on quality workmanship
  • Good problem solving skills
  • Able to work with minimal supervision and as part of a crew
  • Willing to learn and have a strong work ethic
  • Be physically fit
  • Be a genuine team player

We seek applicants with a positive attitude towards maintaining a safe working environment and motivated to helping our client achieve Zero Harm.

Supervisory Level:

• 10 years final trim Grader experience
• Proven ability to lead a crew and run jobs
• GPS experience a bonus but not essential
• Ability to operate other various machinery Eg: Digger, Bully (again not essential)

If this sounds like you and you would like to apply for this role or for more information please contact Fern at Stellar Workforce on 09 969 1028 or email your CV to fern.d@stellarworkforce.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Experienced Digger Operators needed for immediate start!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Stellar Recruitment is your number one choice for finding the best job opportunities in the civil construction market in 2016.

Our clients want us to find the best excavator operators we can! With drainage projects increasing, we want to hear from skilled excavator operators with drainage experience. 

If you can say yes to the following then we want to hear from you.

  • Class 1, WTR, with Class 2 advantageous
  • Pipe installation and/or pipe renewal projects
  • Deep drainage experience up to 6m
  • Digging inside trench shields with and without spotter assistance
  • Digging around services in and above the ground
  • Able to dig to height and levels
  • Final trim experience advantageous
  • Trenching and backfilling
  • Experience on machines up to 20 tonne
  • Ability to assist with ground works


If your skills and experience are described in the above, then Stellar want to hear from you.

You will also have:

  • The right to work in New Zealand
  • A good level of physical fitness
  • Demonstrate sound Health and Safety practices

 

For further information about this role or to discuss other positions on offer, please contact Fern Dickinson on 09 969 1028 or email fern.d@stellarworkforce.co.nz

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Customer Support Representative - Gunnedah - Long Term Opportunity
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• World Leading OEM Dealership
  • Diverse Role with High Performance Culture
  • Long Term Secure Position

Gunnedah based Customer Support Representative required for this world leading OEM. Do you have an earthmoving/automotive dealership background with strong customer service sales?

Our client is a major OEM dealership to the mining & construction industries worldwide. Due to further growth and continued sales within Australia, there is a current requirement for a competent Customer Support Sales Representative to service the Gunnedah branch, NSW.

Successful candidates will be required to have the following experience:

  • Previous experience working for a major OEM either Earthmoving or Automotive
  • A mechanical aptitude or parts interpreting background (highly desirable)
  • Strong communication and face to face customer service experience
  • Computer Literate
  • Forklift License (Desirable)

The key responsibilities within this role will be:

  • To maximise business turnover and provide strong customer service to our client's diverse range of clients.
  • Coordinate parts sales and offer customer support whilst liaising with the clients to enhance close working relationships.
  • Meet company KPI’s to help increase company machine sales, and various other after sales offerings.
  • Support the company profile to work in an environment that promotes continuous improvement.

This impressive organisation boasts a strong company culture that provides an enjoyable and supportive environment to progress your career. You will also be supported by an experienced team allowing you to develop your technical skills within an expanding OEM group!

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below.
Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number LE28391

Consultant: Lucas Eyers
Email: lucas@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Calling all Plumbers - Christchurch Region
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Calling all Plumbers!

Right now we are actively seeking Trade Qualified Plumbers, who are confident in all aspects of plumbing, to take on a variety of major commercial and domestic projects within the general vicinity of Christchurch.

Scope of work includes; Commercial Maintenance, New installs, Renovations, Upgrades maintenance from new housing, to light commercial work.

All applicants for this role will need;

  • At least 5 years industry experience
  • A minimum of 2 years’ experience in NZ
  • Trade Qualification (either in NZ or overseas) – to be a certifying plumber would be advantageous
  • To be currently registered/licensed with the Plumbers, Drainlayers and Gasfitters Board of NZ.
  • Have a solid understanding of the current New Zealand Plumbing Regulations, health and safety (HSE/OSH).
  • A clean full drivers licence (minimum of class 1,),
  • Your own reliable transport
  • Christchurch based, or be willing to relocate
  • To have a high standard or workmanship,
  • To be reliable and able to work unsupervised and
  • At least two referees that attest to your honesty, work ethic and drive.
     

Working as part of team is also important due to the critical timeframes involved in these projects.

Ideally you will be able to provide your own hand and power tools and a site safe card would benefit your application.

Stellar are looking for ambitious, capable and energetic people with a good dose of common sense to join our team. We work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we're only as good as our people, and we've been successfully growing over the past 7 years, partnering with skilled tradesmen and large organisations, because of it.

We offer the opportunity for career progression, the potential for permanent employment and work in a supportive environment. With Stellar Recruitment, you are more than just a number – we will work with you to ensure that the role you accept is the right fit for you – not just another job.

We are aware that wages don’t work for everyone, so also offer a contracting option with all invoices paid weekly – Whatever works for you!

Applicants should be aware that both our, and our clients Health and Safety Standards are very high and we reserve the right to conduct a drug test pre-employment as well as random alcohol and drug testing throughout employment.

If you would like to apply for this role or for more information please contact Leah at Stellar Workforce on 03 3535681 today.

JobListing.JobTitle: Intermediate - Senior Civil Engineer land and site
JobListing.ShortDescription: Intermediate to Senior Civil Engineer for Emerging Consultancy with focus on sub divisions
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
3 months into 2016 Civil Engineers stick or twist?
Somehow we have blinked and we are now 3 months into 2016, the year has started quickly and in all accounts is looking to be exciting, busy and very prosperous, or is it? Incidentally what is the view like in your office? If you’re reading this at work I can only assume it’s pretty bleak.
Stellar have been busy forging and strengthening relationships and really delving and uncovering the goals or our clients and are very happy to be supporting this emerging client in growing on its existing high performance and healthy work life balance.
With Long established rock solid reputation and growing success built around its existing team, growth is now the word and this company is looking to bring the right staff in to the fold. With openings for intermediate to Senior Engineers, career plans are waiting for the right candidate who feels they want to pursue and develop their career further in to the management field. Every avenue is covered from soft skill training to freedom to express yourself. If you have an eye on the future there can only be one course of action, get in touch today.

What you will need
• 5+years design experience
• New Zealand Experience
• Strong Sub division experience
• Ability to liaise with clients
• Ambition to grow and develop

What this company will give you
• Great company culture
• Guided career path
• Annual Bonus
• Flexible structured hours
*********************************************************************
I must implore you that New Zealand experience is essential and I cannot consider anyone without recent New Zealand experience.
**********************************************************************
So if you’re tired of flicking through social media every 10 minutes, watching the kettle boil is not making the day run any faster, then I think it is really time to venture out further. At stellar we really believe in partnership and strong relationships and that only comes from listening, and finding out what you want. The best way to see your dreams come true is to voice them, if you match the above criteria then please email adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 09 9691029 and lets change the years forecast together. Your cards may have been dealt but that doesn’t mean this will be your hand for life, the dealer is now looking at you, It’s your turn what will it be? Stick or twist?
 

Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
E- adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: An exciting opportunity is available for an experienced Recruitment Consultant to join our growing Brisbane team.

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Join our strong, vibrant and successful culture
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: Competitive base and above market uncapped commissions

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Brisbane CBD location
• Competitive base and above market uncapped commissions
• Join our strong, vibrant and successful culture

About Stellar:
Stellar are committed to delivering the highest quality recruitment solutions to our clients and candidates. We build lasting partnerships with employers and offer job seekers life-changing career opportunities. Our high calibre team are driven by our vision to be the number one choice in global resources and infrastructure recruitment.

About the job:
An exciting opportunity is available for an experienced Recruitment Consultant to join our growing Brisbane team. This role will specialise in Supply Chain, Procurement and Logistics recruitment across Stellar’s diverse client base predominately within the oil & gas, resources and construction sectors.
Working closely with the existing team, you will continue to develop and maintain strong client and candidate partnerships by focusing on key business development initiatives. You will also partner with existing PSA’s and key clients to develop strategic recruitment plans.

About you:
To be successful in this role, it is essential that you be a high performing recruitment professional with a track record of results and desire to build long lasting relationships. The ideal candidate will possess a minimum of 2 years’ experience in recruitment with demonstrated market knowledge. You must have strong interpersonal and communication skills, a high level of initiative and team work skills and an ability to demonstrate in every way, our Stellar values; Leadership, Positivity and Greatness.

How you will be rewarded:
In return for high levels of drive and energy, as well as an honest and genuine approach to your work, we offer a, flexible and fun work environment, recognition and reward programs, health and wellbeing incentives, excellent earning potential and the prospect to work with a reputable and quickly expanding recruitment organisation.
We pride ourselves on our strong and vibrant culture that promotes and recognises high performers. So if you are looking for a career and not just a job, then this is the role and team for you.

For further information: please contact Tara Walton +61 7 3009 9608 or to apply, click on the below link.

Great futures start here!
http://youtu.be/5Mjikdd16A8

JobListing.ShortDescription: Residentially Based in New Zealand|Top $$|Stable and Progression
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you a qualified Heavy Diesel Mechanic with strong Truck and/or Equipment exposure?
• Do you have strong visual and computerised diagnostic exposure?
• Are you sick of being treated like just another number?
• Want to learn to ski and snow board in your weekends?


Due to continued growth, some exciting, progressive roles have become available for Truck Mechanics to align with one of the market leading companies operating in New Zealand. You will be responsible the planned and reactive maintenance, servicing and diagnostics of many heavy transport units, working within a rapidly expanding workshop with a team of like-minded technicians. Representing some of the most respected brands within New Zealand and internationally, safety standards second to none and an ever expanding workload, there is no better time to look at making the move.

You will need the following:
• Trade Qualified and at least 3 years’ experience within a heavy transport environment.
• Proven exposure in diagnostic equipment with solid fault finding abilities.
• Exposure to a range of heavy transport brands or a solid background specializing.
• Strong self-starter and a desire to grow and progress career.
• Solid understanding of how to be part of an efficient and “well oiled” team, all working toward a common goal.
• Sole charge or field service experience would be advantageous.
• Ability to relocate to New Zealand


ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR THE RIGHT CANDIDATES


To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as shift/roster patterns, location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you could be working on, or for info on the opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

Lexi Brady

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Commercial, residential and Government Projects
Great Salary package $$ + Car + Phone
Genuine Career Progression

If you enjoy getting out into the wide, open spaces, there are many opportunities for recreation including skiing, boating, swimming, fishing or exploring the hills and valleys by foot, mountain bike and more, this role is for you. • Be Quantity Surveyor qualified

This position will give you the opportunity to work alongside expert Quantity Surveyors forming relationships and making connections with key clients.

If you feel a need to regain some forward momentum in your Quantity Surveying career, then joining a consultancy environment to further your competency is a great career move for those who genuinely want to excel in their profession.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Competitive Pay - Training & Development - Rewards
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
An opportunity has arisen for an experienced and energetic Industrial Electrician to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG groups. With business booming, we are looking for someone who shows commitment to the job and will go above and beyond to get things done.

You are able to work in a sole charge capacity, you have impeccable time management skills and you are committed to safety. You are required to have a firm understanding of electrical equipment, as well as proven experience in electrical maintenance in production environments. You are a strong self-starter, open to change and adjust well to new environments. You want to continue to develop yourself professionally and you will have:

  • A current EWRB Registration

  • Solid working knowledge of SCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • Are open to change and adjust well to unique environments

This role will have you working as part of a maintenance team, playing a key part in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. This group invests in its people and an attractive pay packet will be offered for the right person.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our specialist maintenance trade and electrical recruiter today.

 

Charlotte Heystek

JobListing.ShortDescription: Senior Bridging Engineer New Zealand experience technical, project focussed 8/10 years of strictly bridging experience
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Job satisfaction, excitement, and comradery how good would that be? Imagine finishing work after a long week and winding down with your colleagues on a Friday discussing the highlights of the week, plans for the weekend and in general enjoying the culture and the people you work with.

Stellar have great pleasure in partnering with a real emerging powerhouse in the Structural world who are looking for the right person to bring into the fold. JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• SOLID | STABLE |PROGRESSIVE | VARIETY | FUN
• Calling all DAF, Kenworth or Cummins trained technicians
• Strong Company with a culture all about their people.
• Canterbury, NZ Based positions available with a huge emphasis on progression and development.

Due to strong continued growth, a promising opportunity has arisen for a Truck Mechanic to work for a top company, operating throughout New Zealand. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance and repair of a wide range of heavy truck and trailer units and buses in a workshop capacity with a field aspect as required. Working with a fleet that utilises some of the best technology available in the market, industry safety standards that are second to none and a wealth of knowledge in their leadership teams, you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your technical skills and experience, and will be rewarded with progression opportunities and one of the strongest pay packages in the market.

You’ll need to have the following:
• Trade Certification with experience within the New Zealand or International market.
• At least 3 years experience as a truck technician or in a heavy transport environment.
• Heavy Transport licences would be highly considered
• Desire to progress your career through working with an advanced fleet and state of the art technology.
• Excellent computer diagnostic skills and passion for providing a quality service.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR SUITABLE CANDIDATES

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best and progress your career, or perhaps you’re looking to work for a company that values their employees and has a great company culture - either way, this position is an ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals. As an employer this company has a strong market profile and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Long Term Contract Role
  • Global Mining House
  • Focus on Business / System Improvement

Stellar Recruitment is pleased to offer an exceptional opportunity that has arisen with a long established mining house in QLD Coal. This company has multiple operations throughout the Bowen Basin. They are reliable, cost effective and innovative and offer a dynamic and culturally diverse workplace.

Reporting to the Technical Services Manager this newly created hybrid role incorporates some aspects of a typical Dispatch Engineer position whilst also looking at Systems and Business improvement within the technical services department.

The scope of the role is likely to include but not excluded to:

  • Report Development across Maintenance, Operations, Corporate
  • Data ownership/ integrity, systems improvement,
  • Dispatch 6 implementation
  • Analysing data and coming up with solutions to streamline current systems in place

To be considered for the role we would be looking for the following:

  • Mine Engineering Degree and/or IT qualifications
  • Business improvement / systems development experience
  • Dispatch background
  • Strong data analysis skills
  • Mining Industry background preferred

The position will initially be offered as an on-going contract. Camp accommodation provided, FIFO from Brisbane is an option on a Monday to Friday Roster, along with DIDO from Mackay / Rockhampton.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Genuine leader for high end resi builds needed. Start right away
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Have variety in your day and run multiple construction sites working for a well-respected and growing business

• Permanent position with a professional, well set up organisation
• Projects won and ready to go
• Commercial fit out included

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a company that has a very clear idea of who they are and what they represent in the market. Based in fast paced environment you will be playing an integral part in the building process, working for an organisation with a stable amount of prominent construction on the go. This organisation is fast becoming a leading contractor in the region.

This company prides itself on producing quality commercial builds, with staff that are solutions focused, professional, and work cohesively on projects. In this role you will be working closely with a Senior Project Manager and Quantity Surveyor, and depending on the site a Senior Site Manager as well, to drive construction to a high level, and deliver on time and on budget.

To be successful in this position you will:
• Strong communication skills
• Have a trade certified carpetendry background
• Demonstrate knowledge of commercial and residential construction
• Have New Zealand experience working in commercial and or residential construction is a requirement
• Have at least 3 years’ experience as a Site Manager/Supervisor in a similar type role or you will be a strong foreman looking or that next step in your career
• Have a strong understanding of local building codes and a substantial amount of recent New Zealand experience

You will lead by example and have a client focused approach to your work. You will be able to organise your site and have it running to ensure quality, health and safety, sub trades and materials are organised well. A high amount of autonomy in trust will be placed in your position.

This company has roots well embedded in the wider region and is mature in its approach to company growth – ensuring they do not exceed their optimum amount of staff. This is an exciting and long term opportunity.

If you have a no job is to hard attitude, and just want to put in a good days work with a dedicated group of people, for a company with low staff turnover then apply right now as this job will be filled quickly! Your application will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Civil Engineer either Water, Roading or earthworks experience to run and grow a team
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Infrastructure Team Leader -

Career defining role with strong mentorship, attractive salary and high level responsibility, highly regarded Engineering firm

Passionate about Career Development and achieving business goals
Proactive mentor environment whilst mentoring others
Global engineering firm highly regarded for engineering projects
Lucrative remuneration package plus benefits and enviable culture

Due to continual growth and development this highly regarded global engineering firm is looking to expand the team by adding the experience of a highly experienced infrastructural Engineer with a diverse range of projects under their belt to lead their team. In this role, you will play an integral part of the New Zealand team by delivering infrastructural engineering projects (roading and civil) on time, growing the South Island business through developing existing and new client relationships and mentor engineers with your technical and analytical expertise.

You will report to a senior Director who possesses 20+ year’s experience and has a history of business growth, a highly regarded technical knowledge and a wealth of international experience. He is also passionate about continual improvement of himself and his team.

To be successful in this position you must possess the following:
• Ideally 10+ years post graduate Engineering experience
• At least 5+ years in the NZ Infrastructure sector - Roads or civil
• Tertiary qualifications in Engineering and CPeng
• Previous work experience within an engineering consultancy in NZ
• Strong understanding of NZ Standards (dynamic and seismic analysis)
• Strong technical ability across commercial build, bridge, infrastructure, water and power projects
• Proven ability to manage a team of professionals
• Preferred network of contacts within NZ
• Strong focus on professional development

In return for your experience, you will receive:
• Very competitive remuneration package
• Proactive mentor environment
• Senior member of a high performance team
• Responsibility for you team and results
• Opportunity for global engineering exposure
• Diversity of projects across the South island
• Family orientated culture and lifestyle benefits

So if you have the technical ability and passion for driving a business to achieve results as well as a history of successfully delivering projects, I urge you to apply.

JobListing.ShortDescription: $90k - $100k + Bonus / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions /

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Christchurch - $90,000 - $100,000 + Bonuses + Private Use Company Vehicle
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Well Established & Reputable Christchurch Civil Contractor

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

JobListing.ShortDescription: $90k - $100k + Bonus / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions /

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Christchurch - $90,000 - $100,000 + Bonuses + Private Use Company Vehicle
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Well Established & Reputable Christchurch Civil Contractor

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Foreman for residential construction
  • Manage three sites on Auckland’s North Shore, West Auckland and South Auckland
  • Attractive hourly rates and company vehicle

Stellar Recruitment are currently partnered with a premier constructor who is looking for motivated and capable Foreman to manage three sites across Auckland. This exclusive role would suit someone who has experience with project builds as well as high end residential renovations, and is able to manage a small team of carpenters. Willingness to jump on the tools and help out when needed would be highly advantageous.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • 7+ years’ experience as a foreman within the construction industry
  • LBP status prefered
  • Experience managing multiple residential sites
  • Experience managing teams of carpenters or contractors
  • Experience working on project builds and high end residential renovations
  • A clean driver’s license
  • Your own tools
  • Additional health and safety qualifications are advantageous

In return the client offers:

  • Great working conditions and company culture, with regular workplace events and BBQ’s
  • A supportive work environment
  • Competitive remuneration with regular reviews
  • Flexibility and work life balance
  • Company vehicle

At Stellar we are as committed to health and safety as our clients, therefore you will be required to pass pre-employment drug and alcohol testing to ensure a safe working environment for all.

If you are a motivated and committed foreman who is looking for their next big career opportunity then don’t hesitate to apply now! Alternatively call or email Gabrielle from Stellar recruitment for more information.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Diverse client facing Business Development/Account Management role

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Build lasting partnerships with our blue chip clients
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint2: Work with an innovative, motivated and passionate team of high performers
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Partner with a reputable global brand experiencing significant local growth

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
On offer with Stellar Workforce is not just a job, but a career full of success and opportunities with a global brand.

  • Build lasting partnerships with our blue chip clients
  • Work with an innovative, motivated and passionate team of high performers
  • Partner with a reputable global brand experiencing significant local growth

About Stellar:
The Stellar team are committed to delivering the highest quality solutions to our clients and candidates. We build lasting partnerships with our blue chip clients and offer job seekers life-changing career opportunities.

Our high calibre team are driven by our vision to be the number one choice in global resources and infrastructure recruitment and labour and our core values; leadership, positivity and greatness.

About the job:
Due to our continued growth and several major contract wins, we have created a diverse client facing Business Development/Account Management role. Located in the Hunter Valley region and with scope to grow and truly make the role your own some of your key responsibilities will include

  • Being the key point of contact for Stellar Recruitment clients locally in the Hunter Valley across various workshops, mine and project sites.
  • Actively engaging and partnering with clients and candidates to promote and support continued growth of our labour hire workforce in the region.
  • Establishing and developing new client relationships
  • Facilitating regular on-site OH&S including toolbox talks, safety meetings and site inductions

About you:
To be successful in this role you will have

  • An understanding and previous exposure to the mining industry including OH&S
  • Relevant industry experience either in recruitment, account management which may include maintenance production related positions.
  • Proven ability to establish and build strong relationships and work autonomously
  • Excellent communication skills interpersonal and organisational and skills.

How you will be rewarded:
Along with a market competitive salary your package will also include a work vehicle, allowances, laptop and phone. You will also have access to our comprehensive employee benefits program including flexible working conditions and health and wellbeing initiatives.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you a qualified Heavy Diesel Mechanic with strong Truck and/or Equipment exposure?
• Do you have strong visual and computerised diagnostic exposure?
• Are you sick of being treated like just another number?
• Want to learn to ski and snow board in your weekends?


Due to continued growth, some exciting, progressive roles have become available for Truck Mechanics to align with one of the market leading companies operating in New Zealand. You will be responsible the planned and reactive maintenance, servicing and diagnostics of many heavy transport units, working within a rapidly expanding workshop with a team of like-minded technicians. Representing some of the most respected brands within New Zealand and internationally, safety standards second to none and an ever expanding workload, there is no better time to look at making the move.

You will need the following:
• Trade Qualified and at least 3 years’ experience within a heavy transport environment.
• Proven exposure in diagnostic equipment with solid fault finding abilities.
• Exposure to a range of heavy transport brands or a solid background specializing.
• Strong self-starter and a desire to grow and progress career.
• Solid understanding of how to be part of an efficient and “well oiled” team, all working toward a common goal.
• Sole charge or field service experience would be advantageous.
• Ability to relocate to New Zealand


ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR THE RIGHT CANDIDATES

JobListing.ShortDescription: Amazing opportunity for the commercially minded person to excel in a rapidly growing business
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Quantity Surveyor / Contracts Administrator

Join a well-established successful commercial contractor that is backed by a comprehensive portfolio of works, has a friendly knowledgeable team of professionals, offering a stable long-term position.
This local well established and very respected commercial contractor who is a recognised leader in quality commercial construction, with expertise in new-build construction, interior fit out and refurbishment works and have a number of new opportunities.
Offer their clients a full range of building solutions, from fast track build projects, estimation and feasibility studies, through to full service, end-to-end delivery of commercial projects. With a strong partnership driven approach and a client focussed business model, this contractor has strong relationships with high profile clients and receives a sturdy amount of repeat business.
A rare opportunity has arisen for a Senior Quantity Surveyor, who brings local market knowledge and experience in commercial construction, to contribute to the on- success of this team. You will be joining an experienced business working from tender to final account on your own projects.

In this position your responsibilities will include:
• Providing accurate cost options for proposed contracts
• Estimation through to managing actual cost against budget through the duration of each project
• Perform detailed take offs
• Costing variations
• Authorising of payments to subcontractor and trade creditors and monitoring of retentions held
• Building and maintaining close client relationships and understanding of their requirements
• Work closely with site management, attending site meetings
• Working to a high level of autonomy

Successful candidates will have:
• A relevant tertiary qualification
• Technical skill and commercial build experience suitable to the role with good practical working knowledge
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and good in a team environment
• Experience with an estimating software package.
• Must have local New Zealand based experience

You will be in a position to significantly contribute to the company’s and your own success, and be able to put your name on successful builds around Christchurch.

If you feel you have the skills, attributes and drive to make a significant contribution to one of Christchurch’s leading commercial construction contractors we would like to hear from you today.

Please call Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, if you would like to know more about this opportunity on 027 635 3330, or brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz. Otherwise we look forward to viewing your application.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Systems Administrator - Gladstone Based - 6 month contract - Call Lucas 0730099621
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Gladstone Based
  • 6 month contract
  • Competitive hourly / day rate

Stellar Recruitment is a leading provider of experienced staff to the resources industry. With a growing footprint we are also working with our clients to assist with Technology projects and Tech recruitment. Currently we have an immediate need for an Operational Systems Administrator based in Gladstone.

Key aspects of the role are:

  • Supporting SQL databases (Dev, Test and Prod), OSI PI Data Historian, Azure and other related business services
  • Maintaining access to data for various internal and external stakeholders
  • Handling monitoring, backups and disaster recovery as required by the CAPMAX project
  • Enforcing policies and procedures governing Cargo Handling Operations Database operations and related issues
  • Provide network infrastructure and security support to the CAPMAX project
  • Liaise with the both the Control Group and CAPMAX Project when implementing or supporting any IT services and systems that are significant to both groups
  • Documentation and Audit Control of physical networks and systems to make more efficient use of existing resources

To be considered for the role you will need to have the following skills / experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in computer science or closely related discipline.
  • Advanced skills configuring and maintaining networking devices and infrastructure. Including Industrial grade Wi-Fi and Fibre technology
  • Extensive experience with Microsoft SCCM, SCOM and Active Directory
  • Experience managing Desktop infrastructure in a corporate environment
  • Strong Hyper-V and virtualisation skills
  • Skills in SQL corporate databases
  • Good understanding of the business information needs of the organisation

Shortlisting will commence immediately for the role, ideally we are looking for a candidate who could start immediately or just after the Easter break. Please note only candidates based in Gladstone or who have Gladstone accommodation will be considered.

JobListing.ShortDescription: International Brands | Market Leading Training
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you passionate about the agricultural industry?
• Do you want a chance to progress your career as a diesel mechanic?
• Are you looking for a change in scenery?
• Do you want to work for a company that rewards their technicians?


A promising role has arisen for a Diesel Mechanic to work for one of the leaders in the Agricultural Equipment industry in New Zealand. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance, servicing and repair of a wide range of specialised tractors, telehandlers and bailers, as well as a range of axillary agricultural equipment in the workshop and out in the field. You will work for a company that values their staff and encourages progression and career advancement (including international training) from within. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your strong background, solid technical skills and experience and will be rewarded with training opportunities, state of the art work systems, leadership training from strong management teams and a competitive pay packet.

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience maintaining diesel equipment (preferably with an agricultural background) with trade certification while favourable is not essential.
• Experience working in either a workshop or onsite.
• Excellent diagnostic skills both using computer systems and visually.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• A strong ability to be a self-starter and get the job done.

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best and progress your career, or perhaps you’re looking to back your passion for agricultural equipment- either way, this position could be the ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as work hours, location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you could be working on, or for info on the opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

Emily Keene
03 353 5684
emily@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.JobTitle: Intermediate - Senior Civil Engineer land and site
JobListing.ShortDescription: Intermediate to Senior Civil Engineer for Emerging Consultancy with focus on sub divisions
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
3 months into 2016 Civil Engineers stick or twist?
Somehow we have blinked and we are now 3 months into 2016, the year has started quickly and in all accounts is looking to be exciting, busy and very prosperous, or is it? Incidentally what is the view like in your office? If you’re reading this at work I can only assume it’s pretty bleak.
Stellar have been busy forging and strengthening relationships and really delving and uncovering the goals or our clients and are very happy to be supporting this emerging client in growing on its existing high performance and healthy work life balance.
With Long established rock solid reputation and growing success built around its existing team, growth is now the word and this company is looking to bring the right staff in to the fold. With openings for intermediate to Senior Engineers, career plans are waiting for the right candidate who feels they want to pursue and develop their career further in to the management field. Every avenue is covered from soft skill training to freedom to express yourself. If you have an eye on the future there can only be one course of action, get in touch today.

What you will need
• 5+years design experience
• New Zealand Experience
• Strong Sub division experience
• Ability to liaise with clients
• Ambition to grow and develop

What this company will give you
• Great company culture
• Guided career path
• Annual Bonus
• Flexible structured hours
*********************************************************************
I must implore you that New Zealand experience is essential and I cannot consider anyone without recent New Zealand experience.
**********************************************************************
So if you’re tired of flicking through social media every 10 minutes, watching the kettle boil is not making the day run any faster, then I think it is really time to venture out further. At stellar we really believe in partnership and strong relationships and that only comes from listening, and finding out what you want. The best way to see your dreams come true is to voice them, if you match the above criteria then please email adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 09 9691029 and lets change the years forecast together. Your cards may have been dealt but that doesn’t mean this will be your hand for life, the dealer is now looking at you, It’s your turn what will it be? Stick or twist?
 

Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
E- adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Senior Structural Engineer Auckland with or working towards CPENG with a minimum of 6+ years experience, strong proficiency with ETABS, SpaceGASS.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Structural Design Engineers, are you on track with your 5 year plan?
The dreaded 5 year plan, your ideological path to success over the next 5 years but is your current company going to help you achieve this? Whether it’s career path, team culture, progression and of course money, all of these factor in to your success, and your enjoyment of the role, but do you have what you want?

Stellar has partnered with an emerging consultancy who have one goal in mind…***GROWTH. With strong fundamentals and family ideals within the company who value and implement your input, this is a real opportunity for a Senior Structural Engineer with or working towards **CPENG with a minimum of 6+ years’ experience and have strong proficiency with ETABS, SpaceGASS.

Your responsibilities will be to manage structural design of projects varying in size from medium to large, have strong ability and confidence liaising with varying professionals from: Clients, Contractors to Architects, as well as advising during design and construction stage on various projects.

What this company will offer you:
• Clear supported career progression
• Exciting projects
• Sense of value and appreciation
• No corporate politics

What we require from you:

• CPENG or working towards your Chartership
• New Zealand Experiance
• 6+ years Structural Design Experience
• Client facing skills
• Strong proficiency with ETABS and SpaceGass.
• Desire to grow your career

So if your plan needs help, maybe you feel undervalued, tired of the corporate world, or just fancy a change I am here to help. If your skills match above please apply directly with your CV to adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz I must implore that before you apply you must have all documentation to work in New Zealand, and that New Zealand experience is preferred. Take that 1st step today and get in touch, and let’s discuss your next move.

Our client is looking for an experienced Project Manager to join their team working on larger civil projects with a focus on roading and land development. If you have solid experience working as a Project Engineer/Manager on a range of civil construction projects we’d like to hear from you. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a reputable company with a long history in the Auckland market. The project is expected to be kicking off around June / July.

Key duties will include:

  • Managing both operational, financial and contractual aspects of the project
  • Organising all the required materials
  • Maintain health and safety standards across all sites
  • Manage subcontractors
  • Client Liaison
  • QA, Site Engineering.
  • Monitoring claims, variations, programming and planning
  • Ensure projects are completed on time and to budget

Key requirements for this position include:

  • A minimum of 5-10years’ project engineering or management experience in civil construction
  • Tertiary qualification, ideally BA in Civil Engineering
  • Sound working knowledge of NZ HSE requirements
  • Excellent communication skills with ability to get along well with staff at all levels within the organisation

JobListing.ShortDescription: Amazing opportunity for the commercially minded person to excel in a rapidly growing business
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Senior Quantity Surveyor / Contracts Administrator

Join a well-established successful commercial contractor that is backed by a comprehensive portfolio of works, has a friendly knowledgeable team of professionals, offering a stable long-term position.
This local well established and very respected commercial contractor who is a recognised leader in quality commercial construction, with expertise in new-build construction, interior fit out and refurbishment works and have a number of new opportunities.
Offer their clients a full range of building solutions, from fast track build projects, estimation and feasibility studies, through to full service, end-to-end delivery of commercial projects. With a strong partnership driven approach and a client focussed business model, this contractor has strong relationships with high profile clients and receives a sturdy amount of repeat business.
A rare opportunity has arisen for a Senior Quantity Surveyor, who brings local market knowledge and experience in commercial construction, to contribute to the on- success of this team. You will be joining an experienced business working from tender to final account on your own projects.

In this position your responsibilities will include:
• Providing accurate cost options for proposed contracts
• Estimation through to managing actual cost against budget through the duration of each project
• Perform detailed take offs
• Costing variations
• Authorising of payments to subcontractor and trade creditors and monitoring of retentions held
• Building and maintaining close client relationships and understanding of their requirements
• Work closely with site management, attending site meetings
• Working to a high level of autonomy

Successful candidates will have:
• A relevant tertiary qualification
• Technical skill and commercial build experience suitable to the role with good practical working knowledge
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and good in a team environment
• Experience with an estimating software package.
• Must have local New Zealand based experience

You will be in a position to significantly contribute to the company’s and your own success, and be able to put your name on successful builds around Christchurch.

If you feel you have the skills, attributes and drive to make a significant contribution to one of Christchurch’s leading commercial construction contractors we would like to hear from you today.

Please contact Matt if you have any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this position. Otherwise you can express your interest by applying today. Your application will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Top Brands | Strong Leadership Internally | Untapped Opportunities | Ag Sector
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Top of the line equipment and strong international brands.
• Small but modern teams with huge growth potential in the near future
• Progressive company with a family culture all about their people.
• Pivotal role within the Canterbury Agricultural sector.

Due to strong continued growth, a promising opportunity has arisen for a Service/ Operations Manager to work for a top agricultural company, operating throughout the region. In this position you will play a pivotal role in the leading and managing a solid branch in the agricultural sector and the teams within to grow and support a solid, but ever morphing, agricultural equipment market in the thriving Canterbury sector. Overseeing a strong team of dedicated technicians in the workshop and the field, playing a part in the on-going maintenance repair and on-going growth of the well-known brands they support, you will back this with a solid understanding of what makes a strong team tick, leading the charge with your own ability to set and achieve budgets and re work to a minimum and with an ability to understand and adjust P&L’s. You will be familiar with driving and promoting the progression of individuals within the team, including training of apprentices, accreditation of existing staff and growing existing business within the market as well as seeing opportunities yet to be tapped into. Working with a brands that utilises some of the best technology available in the market, industry safety standards that are second to none and a wealth of knowledge in their teams, you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your managerial skills and experience in the sector, and will be rewarded with progression opportunities and a strong salary with performance based incentives.

You’ll need to have the following:
• Ideally Trade Certification (equipment or engineering) within the agricultural sector within the New Zealand or Australian market.
• At least 5 years’ experience in a leadership capacity as a workshop manager or service management type role.
• Strong Farming practice experience would be highly advantageous.
• Excellent interpersonal skills and a passion for providing a quality service to both staff and clients alike.
• Strong leadership style and an open door policy.
• Ability to relocate and be residentially based throughout Canterbury.
As an employer this company has a strong market profile, family values and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential and with upcoming growth and expansion inevitable, there has never been a better time to make your mark in the industry.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the brands you’ll be working on, or for info on other opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our maintenance team today.

Emily Keene, Division Manager
+643 353 5684
emily@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: Join a Leading NZ Commercial Builder / Deliver an Iconic $120M Building in Christchurch / CIRCA $120-135K (Relocations/Flights neg.) / IMMED START!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Relocate to New Zealand via Stellar
  • Busy Building Industry, Multiple REAL Jobs
  • CIRCA $120-135K, Immediately Start Available!

Stellar Recruitment has offices in Christchurch and Auckland in addition to Perth, and we are currently working to place an experienced commercial building Senior Site Manager with a leading building company in Christchurch, New Zealand.

Stellar Recruitment is well established in New Zealand with existing relationships with many of the busiest building companies involved in the Christchurch rebuild program, and throughout New Zealand on other significant building projects. We are sourcing now to find a Senior Site Manager to lead the construction of an iconic $120m landmark building in Christchurch. This company has a terrific brand in the NZ building sector and a bulging order book of key projects to deliver in the next 5-10 years.

In addition to this role, we have multiple similar roles available for Site Managers and Senior Site Managers in Auckland and other parts of NZ. Applicants require 5-20 years of Site Management experience in Australia or NZ on schools, hospitals, commercial office buildings or similar valued $20m-$200m.

To be considered for this Christchurch Senior Site Manager position or similar roles in New Zealand, you must have a stable work history and relevant experience as a Site Manager working for Tier 1 & Tier 2 building contractors successfully delivering similar types of building projects as those listed above, strong leadership qualities, and you must have a willingness and ability to relocate to NZ within the next few months. You must also have existing rights to live and work in New Zealand and a desire to remain for 3-4 years minimum.

This is a really attractive opportunity to lock in some job security for the foreseeable future and get stuck into live projects with a company that has strong workflow and multiple projects, many of which are changing the face of Christchurch.

Remuneration packages in New Zealand are improving and as Senior Site Manager you can expect CIRCA $120-135K package (relocation/flights negotiable). New Zealand is the adventure capital of the world with a fabulous lifestyle and lower cost of living, so if this sounds exciting to you, please get in touch with us today!

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number SA28662.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Work for a prestigious longstanding builder on high-end, one off, architecturally designed homes
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Established company
Large team of builders
Independent position

We are currently looking for a strong Quantity Surveyor to work for a very well respected, award winning, recognised local builder based in Queenstown. This rare position has become available due to growth. This is a full time long term position with continuing growth in the future.

This company has been in operation for 40 years and still remains as a modern cutting edge operation. You will be joining a team of office based and site based staff of 45, working on large one off high scale homes and some light commercial projects. These builders really are experts in their field.

This is an independent position so you must have at least three years’ experience running projects from tender to handover with full Quantity Surveying responsibility’s in-between.

To be considered for this positon you will ideally have:
- Recent commercial or architectural experience
- A relevant qualification
- At least 3 years Quantity Surveying experience from take-off to hand over
- Professional presentation and communication
- A down to earth team player attitude

Your position will include:
-Tendering
- Detailed estimation
- Pricing and scheduling of all quantities
- Liaison with clients, design consultants and construction contractors
- Contract administration
- Cost-management
- Variations
- Progress payments
- Final account

For a genuine career opportunity to work in one of the most beautiful places in the world, not to mention the number of activities and fine dining, in a role where you will have high responsibility, variation and challenging projects, simply apply with your CV now or call Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, to discuss further on 027 635 3330.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Work on high end one-off builds
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
- Queenstown based, full time position
- Architectural, exciting and interesting builds
- Established well regarded building company with an impressive portfolio of works

Reporting into the Managing Director you will be running the sales process from initial consultation to final hand over on new home builds for family’s and professionals, across multiple sites in the Queenstown area.

You will be working for an established building contractor that is known and well regarded in the market that carries its own professional builders. You will need to be relationship focused as you will be assisting and guiding the clients through every stage of the build and decision making process.

This company is offering strong support, reliable systems, but the freedom to do it your way with good earning potential on top your salary base. You will be working in prominent areas, with project value's from $400,000 - $1million+, typically $600,000 +.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Initial consultation with perspective buyers
- Sales contract and negotiation
- Full agreeance of build plan and specifications
- Dealing closely in-house Project Manager’s to ensure all speciation’s are workable
- All client liaison
- You will need to have an intimate understanding of the building process and products/furnishings

To be considered for this position you will:
- Have sales experience relative to the construction industry, ideally in new home builds
- Have a client lead, relationship based sales style
- Be self-motivated and proactive
- Worked in fast passed sales environments
- Worked on many projects/sales at various stages at one give time
- Be able to relocate easily, or already be based in Queenstown for this long term career position.

If working in the adventure capital of the world, on world class residential builds, for an established company with a good brand sounds like you, we look forward to viewing your application.

We are looking to fill this, and another New Homes Sales position also based in Queenstown, ASAP. If you have any questions in the meantime please do not hesitate to call Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, for a private conversation on 03 974 2442 or 027 635 3330.

JobListing.ShortDescription: CALLING ALL KENWORTH, DAF AND CUMMINS TRAINED TRUCK TECHNICIANS | NZ ROLES WITH ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED | PROGRESSION & TRAINING | TOP DEALERSHIP
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• SOLID | STABLE |PROGRESSIVE | VARIETY | FUN
• Calling all DAF, Kenworth or Cummins trained technicians
• Strong Company with a culture all about their people.
• Canterbury, NZ Based positions available with a huge emphasis on progression and development.

Due to strong continued growth, a promising opportunity has arisen for a Truck Mechanic to work for a top company, operating throughout New Zealand. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance and repair of a wide range of heavy truck and trailer units and buses in a workshop capacity with a field aspect as required. Working with a fleet that utilises some of the best technology available in the market, industry safety standards that are second to none and a wealth of knowledge in their leadership teams, you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your technical skills and experience, and will be rewarded with progression opportunities and one of the strongest pay packages in the market.

You’ll need to have the following:
• Trade Certification with experience within the New Zealand or International market.
• At least 3 years experience as a truck technician or in a heavy transport environment.
• Heavy Transport licences would be highly considered
• Desire to progress your career through working with an advanced fleet and state of the art technology.
• Excellent computer diagnostic skills and passion for providing a quality service.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR SUITABLE CANDIDATES

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best and progress your career, or perhaps you’re looking to work for a company that values their employees and has a great company culture - either way, this position is an ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals. As an employer this company has a strong market profile and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Service Technicians required for Geraldton, Katanning & Esperance. Full Time - Industry leader in Agriculture Equipment - International Training!!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Do Tractors, Harvesters and Balers spin your wheels?
• Do you want a chance to progress your career as a diesel mechanic?
• Want to work for a company whose talk turns into action?
• Want the opportunity to fly internationally for your training?
• Do you want to work for a company that rewards their technicians?

A promising role has arisen for 3 Agricultural Mechanics / Field Service Mechanics to work for one of the leaders in the agricultural equipment industry based in Geraldton, Katanning and Esperance. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance, servicing and repair of a wide range of specialised Tractors, Harvesters and Bailers, as well as a range of auxiliary agricultural equipment in the workshop and out in the field. You will work for a company that values their staff and encourages progression and career advancement (including international training) from within. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your strong background, solid technical skills and experience and will be rewarded with training opportunities, state of the art work systems, leadership training from strong management teams and a competitive pay packet. Relocation could be available for top notch candidates.

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience maintaining diesel equipment (preferably with an agricultural background) with trade certification while favourable is not essential.
• Experience working in either a workshop or onsite.
• Excellent diagnostic skills both using computer systems and visual fault finding skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• A strong ability to be a self-starter and get the job done.

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best and progress your career, or you’re looking to back your passion for agricultural equipment- either way, this position could be the ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals.

To apply or to find out more details contact Richard on 08 9422 2726 or Richard.S@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Highly reputable WA Building Company / SOR Location, Avoid Traffic, On site parking/Start on Contract, Permanent options if you excel/CIRCA $70/hr
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Superb WA Building Company
  • South of the River Location, Avoid Traffic!
  • CIRCA $70/hr, Permanent Role Available!

Our client is an established and successful West Australian civil and building construction contractor that has an IMMEDIATE need to recruit a contract Estimator to join their experienced team based in Perth’s southern suburbs. There is a strong possibility this role will go permanent in time. This business delivers construction projects typically valued up to $5m which may include; commercial and industrial buildings (public and private sector), apartments, mixed use developments and minor civil infrastructure (earthworks and concrete).

Working for this company is rewarding. You’ll join a professional team with great leadership who are vastly experienced in the delivery of construction projects in Western Australia. They have a superb 40 year track record of successfully delivering high quality, safe projects under their ISO9001:2008 Quality accreditation and AS/NZS4801:2001 Safety accreditation.

This Estimator role will involve preparing pricing for a variety of projects involving insitu structures, brickwork and tilt panels, that may be metro based or remote projects in Western Australia. This initial 4 week contract position will therefore appeal to an Estimator seeking diverse project exposure, and increased responsibility and ownership over winning new projects for the business. The prospect of this role moving to a permanent position is extremely high for a candidate who excels in this role.

It is essential that applicants have previously worked as an Estimator for building companies pricing projects valued up to $5m-$10m in Western Australia. Your role will involve reading plans and interpreting specifications to accurately perform detailed take offs and prepare cost plans for new projects. You will also issue tender packages to suppliers and subcontractors.

To be considered for this role ideally you will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Construction Management & Economics, Quantity Surveying or Engineering
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as an Estimator for a commercial building company in WA
  • Proven ability to prepare “first principle” estimates on building/civil projects up to $10m
  • Previous success preparing successful tenders for public sector building developments.
  • Excellent computer literacy and ability to use Quest/Expert Estimation software or similar
  • A great attitude to work and a friendly disposition
  • Currently based in Perth with existing rights to live and work in Australia.

You will be offered a superb contract rate of CIRCA $70/hr as the successful candidate which will be tailored to your level of career experience to date. A permanent salary will be negotiated later if you excel in this contract role.

The company office is located in Perth’s southern suburbs so will suit a candidate based south of the river who wishes to avoid the daily grind of city traffic. This is an IMMEDIATE requirement so those able to start at short notice will be highly regarded.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number SA28688.

Consultant: Scott Alexander

Phone: 08 9422 2702

Email: scott@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Front End Web Developer - Brisbane Based - Join one of Australia's fastest growing Tech Companies
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Brisbane Based Position
  • Successful and Growing Tech-Start Up
  • Great Company Culture and Team

Our business Stellar Technology has close ties to the growing and exciting Tech-Start up scene in Brisbane, Australia. There is a real buzz in the city and a lot of investment from both government and corporate in this space. With an increasing shortage of Developers, pay rates increasing, excellent climate and relatively low cost of living compared to other cities, Brisbane offers a great option if you are looking to further your career.

Our client, an award winning and one of Australia’s fastest growing companies is currently looking for a Front End Web Developer to join there high performing team in central Brisbane. The business has a great company culture, is young and dynamic and has a great leadership team.

Key aspects of the role include:

  • Being involved in the technical direction of front end technologies
  • Work with JavaScript frameworks to create scalable applications
  • Testing to ensure stability and reliability of applications
  • Create usable and performance driven UI components
  • Designing tools, such as style guides to ensure other developers can work on the application

To be considered for the role you will need to have the following experience:

  • At least 3 years working with JavaScript
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks and libraries e.g. ReactJS or Angular JS
  • Ideally have experience building responsive web applications
  • Knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3, including pre-processors such as Sass or LESS
  • Can create workflows using tools like NPM and Gulp

This is a great opportunity to get involved with a fast growing and innovate company who have global ambitions and are disrupting the market they are currently operating in.

In addition to the above role we are also looking for talented Front End and Back End WordPress developers and are generally interested in speaking to any IT professionals who might be interested in working in Australia.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below or send me an email directly quoting reference number LE28673

Consultant: Lucas Eyers
Email: lucas@stellartechnology.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: $90k - $100k + Bonus / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions / 55 Hours Monday - Friday

Bulletpoints.BulletPoint1: Christchurch - $90,000 - $100,000 + Bonuses + Private Use Company Vehicle
Bulletpoints.BulletPoint3: Well Established & Reputable Christchurch Civil Contractor

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz
