JobListing.ShortDescription: $90,000 - $100,000 / Company Vehicle / Leading Civil Contractor / Professional Development Opportunities
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: IMMED START! / Terrific National Tier 1 Construction Contractor / Major Project / Manage & Coordinate Exchange of Project Information / CIRCA $170K
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Major Civil Infrastructure Project (Perth)
  • Coordinate & Manage Project Information Flow
  • CIRCA $170K, IMMED Start!

About the Company:

Our client is a highly regarded Tier 1 multi-disciplinary contractor currently undertaking a major civil infrastructure project in Perth. Their business is synonymous with the planning and construction of some of Australia’s largest civil infrastructure projects nationwide including roads & major freeways, railway systems, tunnels and dams.  

About the Role:

As Engineering Interface Manager on this interesting and unique project, you will be responsible for implementation and maintenance of the interface management process throughout the project lifecycle. You will establish a framework for communication and exchange of information between engineering disciplines and project participants in a timely and efficient manner. The ultimate aim of the Engineering Interface Manager will be to remove or minimize risks associated with ongoing design development and project changes that may impact cost and schedule.

Duties:

  • Identification of internal and external interface relationships
  • Establish interface processes to manage flow of information between design and construction teams
  • Coordinate and monitor status of project interfaces via meetings
  • Facilitate & resolve issues pertaining to information exchange between parties
  • Track and document exchange of information between participants to monitor performance

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 5-10 years’ post graduate experience in Australia managing engineering interface relationships on $200m+ civil infrastructure projects including; roads/rail/tunnels/airports
  • Experience on these projects under Design & Construct contracts working for construction contractors or engineering companies
  • Excellent all-round understanding of interactions associated with design and construction of multi-disciplinary major projects
  • Superb communication skills with ability to influence, coordinate and resolve issues
  • Perth based with existing rights to live and work in Australia

Company Culture:

Working within this highly professional company is rewarding. Employees enjoy the benfit of a highly experienced management team, a terrific team environment, and outstanding opportunities to work on major projects in Australia.

Benefits:

  • Perth based project location, no FIFO!
  • Enhance your career on a major project with a civil contracting leader
  • CIRCA $170K (*dependent on experience)

This position is with a sophisticated Main Contractor and Construction Management company that is making its mark on the Christchurch commercial construction market. With multiple large scale commercial buildings already completed, and new projects won, you will be able to put your name toward some of Christchurch’s major developments, leading the project alongside a Senior Project Manager.

- Final account

- A relevant Qualification

- Have worked as a Quantity Surveyor on projects upwards of $12 million
- Preferably have some New Zealand based experience
- Professional presentation and communication
- A down to earth team player attitude

There is an immediate need for this positon, so this role will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate is secured. This position is based in Christchurch and is a long term full time position. Salary is dependent on the individual’s experience, but is paying up to $130,000. You will need to already be based in Christchurch, or relocate easily at your own expense.

You will be working with an experienced team of mechanics, sales reps and managers who get the variety in their workload most companies only dream of. This company has industry safety standards and systems that are second to none and you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your skill and knowledge base as well as experience within the market. You will be rewarded with a very competitive remuneration package and the opportunity to progress your career to the next step, assisted by a management team who have all started out on the floor.

You’ll need to have the following:

  • 3-5 years’ experience working in either Agriculture or Earthmoving dealerships
  • A mechanical aptitude
  • Current Forklift License
  • Experience in a customer service environment.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Be a strong self-starter with excellent time management and organisational skills

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best or advance your career by aligning with a strong procurement team within the Agriculture industry, either way this position is an ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals. As an employer, this company has a strong market profile and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, or for info on other opportunities that we have throughout Australia please hit apply and one of our team will be in touch.

JobListing.ShortDescription: leading hand required for commercial project, large project with plenty of room to progress to site manager, above market rates, call Gabbie 09 969102
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Carpenter

• Key position on site- Leading a team
• Busy main contractor with many key projects
• Attractive hourly rates and progression to foreman/ site manager available

About the Company:

Stellar Recruitment are currently partnered with a market leading construction company, one of the biggest in New Zealand, who is looking for an experienced and motivated carpenter to assist with some of their biggest projects. This main contractor is currently working on some intricate and exciting projects on the North Shore of Auckland and due to the large amount of work, are looking for a qualified carpenter who can get stuck in and get the job done.

About the Role:

You will be working on a large commercial and residential site where you will be involved in all aspects of the building process. You will be required to lead a group of carpenters and work autonomously on site as well as ensuring everything runs smoothly and to plan. Health and safety will be a big focus for you and you will uphold this to the highest standard, as well as making sure all carpenters adhere to safe work practices at all times.

Duties:

• All aspects of carpentry on site as required
• Leading a group of carpenters on site
• Upholding health and safety requirements to the highest standard
• Complete all work with accuracy and to tight time restrictions
• Interpret plans and blue prints

Skills & Experience:

• Trade Qualified carpenter(Certificate 4 in carpentry as a minimum)
• Working at heights trained ( Unit standard 23229 or 15757)
• Ramset license
• Hilti license
• Dogman Certificate
• EWP trained
• At least 2 years’ experience

Culture:

Our client provides a supportive and safe work environment for all employees. They take pride in their team and provide training and progression opportunities to all employees. Although a large team they are personable and inclusive, the site managers know all their guys by name and enjoy a good laugh throughout the day.

Benefits:

• Progression opportunities
• Supportive friendly work environment
• Completive hourly rates

JobListing.ShortDescription: Highly Successful Civil Contractor | Permanent opportunity, becoming a key team member | Auckland City
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Responsible for construction contracts, QA,  H&S and assisting with site management
  • Well-established and successful civil contractor based in Auckland City
  • Remuneration guideline of $75,000

About the Company

Our client is one of the best known civil contractors in the Auckland Region. They provide a range of services to the civil construction industry and have carved out a solid reputation for a number of specialist construction methods, winning repeat business year on year.

About the Role

As the QA/Contracts Engineer you will need to have a background in Civil Construction. You will be responsible for a variety of functions, which will include assisting the project managers with site documentation, H&S, working on tenders and contract administration. You will be the link between the site teams and the office. There will be requirement for site visits, photographing assignments and reporting. This role would best suit a Civil Engineer with experience on site and wanting to move into the office.

Duties:

  • Site audits and incident investigation

  • Pre start documentation

  • Monitor and record variations

  • Complete QA info for client

  • Complete monthly claims

  • Assist with producing Quotes

  • Order materials, plant and equipment

  • Organise subcontractors and tip sites

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering (diploma, degree)

  • 10+ years’ experience in construction industry

  • Understanding of site engineering, tender preparation and QA work.

  • Solid communication skills and ability to relate to all levels within a business

Culture:

This business has a culture of developing and upskilling their employees, with heavy involvement from directors all the way down to site level. They provide autonomy at every opportunity, while also training and mentoring to allow careers continue in the right direction. It is a relaxed, informal office feel, far from the corporate world of a Tier One contractor. If you enjoy a good laugh at work and being involved in a successful team then this is the role.

Benefits:

  • Decent remuneration

  • Negotiable start and finish times

  • Involvement at the leadership table

  • Exposure to a broad variety of business functions

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Stellar Recruitment is your number one choice for finding the best job opportunities in the civil construction market in 2016.

Our clients want us to find the best excavator operators we can! With drainage projects increasing, we want to hear from skilled excavator operators with drainage experience. 

If you can say yes to the following then we want to hear from you.

  • Class 1, WTR, with Class 2 advantageous
  • Pipe installation and/or pipe renewal projects
  • Deep drainage experience up to 6m
  • Digging inside trench shields with and without spotter assistance
  • Digging around services in and above the ground
  • Able to dig to height and levels
  • Final trim experience advantageous
  • Trenching and backfilling
  • Experience on machines up to 20 tonne
  • Ability to assist with ground works


If your skills and experience are described in the above, then Stellar want to hear from you.

You will also have:

  • The right to work in New Zealand
  • A good level of physical fitness
  • Demonstrate sound Health and Safety practices

 

For further information about this role or to discuss other positions on offer, please contact Fern Dickinson on 09 969 1028 or email fern.d@stellarworkforce.co.nz

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Drainlayers, drainage foremen, leading hands and drainage workers... we have roles right now. Some with immediate starts and others by negotiation.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Rewarding Commercial projects
• New Zealand owned and operated
• People focused culture

About the company:

The opportunity presented is working with an organisation the commercial construction market. With steady growth in the commercial build effort in the Canterbury region, this fast paced commercial contractor is seeking to appoint a Quantity Surveyor to complement their current team.

About the role:

Concentrating on the commercial construction build, the appointee’s role will encompass all aspects of a Quantity Surveyors portfolio, such as preparing tender and contract documentation, cost analysis, allocating work to sub-contractors and producing progress reports.

We are seeking a proven Quantity Surveyor with a background in commercial construction. Concrete experience is an advantage. You will ideally have a contractor side focus with extensive New Zealand experience, supported by a sound understanding of local codes and legislation. You will ideally be adaptable, professional and motivated with experience working with projects with a value between 1-30 million.

Responsibilities:

• Detailed pricing and scheduling of quantities
• Participation in estimation/leading tenders
• Evaluation, selection and negotiation of sub-contract tenders
• Liaison with design consultants and construction sub-contractors
• Contract administration, cost-management, variations, payment claims

Culture:

Construction professionals choose to align their career with this organisation because of their people focused culture, developed and led by their experienced executive team who have worked together over several years. You will be working for a well-known and long established organisation, with a firm focus on maintaining its family feel, high level of job responsibility, and positive enjoyable environment.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Permanent opportunity working with a great team, for someone looking for a job with longevity, who has experience in residential foundations
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
This position is working across multiple sites at various stages, working for a specialised residential and light commercial foundations company. You will be working in a team environment alongside 35 office and site based staff, and be provided with phone and lap top.

This company has a fantastic culture – down to earth but professional and hardworking, where people get along and get on with their areas of specialisation. This is a Canterbury owned and operated company, where you will be reporting into the Managing Director.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Running multiple sites
  • Ensuring budgets and timelines are kept within margin
  • Booking in and organisation of staff and contractors – Excavation, site prep, hard fill, boxing, concrete delivery, pour
  • Communication with geo tech’s and council to ensure correct site prep/foundation
  • Working with rib raft and standard foundation practices


To be successful in this positon:

  • You will not mind Canterbury wide travel in your job
  • You will have technical or practical knowledge of foundation types and processes
  • Could be from a civil concreting background or a residential/commercial build background
  • Will already be based in Christchurch or able to relocate with ease at your own expense
  • Need NZ standards experience


This is a relatively large competitive company with a healthy looking pipeline of work. We are looking to fill this position ASAP, as there are sites waiting for you! Please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant, if you require any further information on this positon on 027 635 3330 or at brooke@stellarrecruitment.co.nz. I am most readily available on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

All applications and conversations are treated as private and confidential and we do not pass your information on until you have agreed to this.

Estimator

  • Price commercial/ Apartment Projects $5 – 40million
  • Competitive salary packages
  • Busy Brisbane client, Immediate Start available!

About the Company:

Our client is a highly respected, long standing Tier 1 commercial/ residential building company and they have an immediate requirement for an Estimator capable of pricing a broad range of future products that may be within sectors such as education, commercial, residential apartments, health care or retail.

About the Role:

As Estimator within this reputable building company, you’ll be based south of Brisbane and focus on compiling estimates for projects within the $5-40m range. You will take responsibility for sourcing subcontractor pricing for strategically targeted tenders for commercial projects primarily in the Brisbane metro region.

Duties:

  • Documenting and facilitating sub-contractor and supplier tender documents and distribution lists
  • Sourcing and analysis of quotations and pricing of works from subcontractors
  • Coding of all estimates in line with company’s budget breakdown schedules
  • Compilation of tender submissions
  • Responding to client queries post tender submission

Skills & Experience:

  • Ideally you will be an Estimator with over 3 years' experience in Australia’s construction sector
  • You have been working for recognized Tier 1 or Tier 2 building contractor
  • Experience with commercial or apartment building tenders is an advantage

Culture:

You will be offered a terrific remuneration package based on your skills, technical competence and previous industry experience. Apply ASAP to join this stable, reputable builder and enjoy a future career that will expose you to a diverse range of projects in Brisbane.

Benefits:

  • Terrific remuneration package

About the Company:

Stellar recruitment is currently partnered with a market leading civil construction company who are looking for skilled professionals to help deliver their company’s needs. These exclusive roles will suit skilled excavator operators in South Auckland, Northshore, and Auckland wide locations who has experience in the earthworks sector.

About the Role:

To be successful in this role, you will have to have the ability to operate a 5tonne excavator up to a 30tonne excavator. These roles will suit someone who has experience in site preparation, bulk loading, final trim work, and someone who isn’t afraid of getting out of the operator and lending a hand on the ground.

Duties:

• Busy Auckland-based contractor with great reputation
  • Highly successful team, consistently winning work
  • Decent salary on offer for the right candidate

Our client is a leading contractor providing a range of services to the civil infrastructure industry. They are currently looking for a versatile an enthusiastic Intermediate-level Estimator.. Away from the chaos, this role would suit candidates looking to get out of the CBD traffic and based North of the Bridge. This role will be an office-based position with very limited site-based responsibility.

Overview:

This role requires a candidate with a solid background in civil works, ideally with experience working on Earthworks, Drainage, Structures and Siteworks.

Reporting to the Operations Manager, key responsibilities will include:

  • scheduling/estimating

  • subcontractor management

  • schedule of quantities and applying rates

  • tender preparation and analysis

  • progress claims and assessing variations

  • Proven ability to win projects

  • Excellent computer skills, knowledge of Excel and Candy Software is key

  • Having a relevant tertiary qualification and relevant training is highly desirable

  • Experience and an excellent understanding of the local market is essential

Culture

This contractor is well-known for retaining it's employees. They are a lively bunch with a passion for their work, and take no chances in their recruitment process. They will find like-minded individuals who share the passion for the industry, good sense of humour and up for a laugh with the team.

JobListing.JobTitle: Graduate Project Manager Cadetship Commercial Co
JobListing.ShortDescription: Incredible opportunity for a graduate to learn from industry leading experts and develop to a Commercial Project Manager
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Genuine once in a lifetime career opportunity
• Successful Australasian commercial construction company
• Learn and develop from industry leading experts

About the company:

We are seeking a motivated, driven individual who is passionate about the construction industry and wants to pursue a career in project management. This large commercial firm is an established and successful design and construction contractor. They operate in all sectors with specialist expertise in commercial, retail, infrastructure and government buildings. After a long and successful portfolio in Australia, they have set up in New Zealand has taken the market by storm over the last few years with offices in Christchurch and Auckland.

About the role:

In this role you will collaborate closely with a senior organisational member, working across organisational divisions to constructively develop your expertise as a project manager. The cadetship takes you through modules that align with all aspects of commercial construction over a period of 2-3 years (may be shorter depending on the person). This role is very much long-term focused, where you will progress to a position as a Commercial Project Manager running architecturally designed multi-million dollar projects. This is a structured development programme with a genuine career progression focus. Following completion of your cadetship, you will collaborate with Engineering Consultancies, Designers, Earthworks, Sub Trades and internal industry experts to ensure timely delivery of projects.

Responsibilities:

• Shadowing/observing staff
• Conduct administrative duties such as data entry in the construction programme
• All remedial and ad hock tasks as requested
• Completing training modules as required
• Updating client and project duties

The ideal candidate should have/be:

• Completed a construction based tertiary qualification
• Based in Christchurch or easily able to relocate at short notice
• Possess strong communication skills (both verbal and written)
• Display a genuine interest in committing to this outstanding organisation
• Long-term career focused to develop as a Project Manager

If you are passionate about the construction industry, have a construction related tertiary qualification, and have a genuine interest to pursue a career in commercial project management, we want to hear from you.

Culture:

Construction professionals choose to align their career with this organisation because of their people focused culture, developed and led by their experienced executive team who have worked together over several years. The project and division leaders have progressed through their strong internal training systems, much like the opportunity available in this role.

How to apply:

Please contact Alisha via email or phone for a confidential discussion. Otherwise you
can express your interest by applying today.

Email: alisha.m@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

• Key position on site- progression opportunities
• Busy main contractor with many key projects
• Attractive hourly rates- Well above market

About the Company:

Stellar Recruitment are currently partnered with a market leading construction company, one of the biggest in New Zealand, who is looking for an experienced and motivated working foreman to assist with some of their biggest projects. This main contractor is currently working on some intricate and exciting projects on the North Shore of Auckland and due to the large amount of work, are looking for a qualified working Foreman who can manage a team to tight deadlines and projects specs.

About the Role:

You will be working on either the large residential or commercial site depending on your area of expertise, where you will be involved in all aspects of the building process. You will be required to lead a group of 20 Carpenters, Builders, Hammerhands and Labourers and ensure everything runs smoothly on site. Health and safety will be a big focus for you and you will uphold this to the highest standard.

Duties:

• Upholding health and safety requirements to the highest standard
• Team leading, keeping your team motivated and on track, ensuring all working is being carried out accurately and in accordance with the site plans.
• Attend meetings with the site manager and report on your progress
• Take direction from site managers and work together to produce great work
• Complete all work with accuracy and to tight time restrictions

Skills & Experience:

• Trade Qualified (preferred)
• Working at heights trained ( Unit standard 23229 or 15757, prefered)
• At least 6 years’ experience

Culture:

Our client provides a supportive and safe work environment for all employees. They take pride in their team and provide training and progression opportunities to all employees. Although a large team they are personable and inclusive, the site managers know all their guys by name and enjoy a good laugh throughout the day.

Benefits:

  • Highly regarded national company with an enviable forward order book
  • Offering $80,000-$90,000 pa… more if you are legend QS!


About the Company:
This group home building company are well established and are at the forefront of some of Auckland’s biggest residential subdivisions. They have a number of major subdivisions and Housing NZ projects around Auckland and given their already established QS team, they expect to win a lot more. This is a national company with franchises all over the country and customers are lining up at the door to experience their service and enjoy their quality of home.

About the Role:
Your role will involve sitting alongside some of the best in the industry and plying your craft as a Residential QS. Being an integral part of the team, you will have the opportunity for innovation and to learn from your peers to keep this company at the forefront of the build industry. You’ll be expected to price jobs, have sound contract administration skills and the ability to create and negotiate the methodology / costs of new house builds on multi dwelling projects.

Duties:

  • Estimating / Pricing
  • Contract administration
  • Negotiate with suppliers / management
  • Client liaison

Skills & Experience:

  • 4+ years of residential QS experience (but will look at less / more depending on sector experience)
  • Tertiary qualifications preferred but not essential
  • Must be level headed and prepared to be part of a team
  • Able to make decisions and back your judgement

Culture:
The company describes its culture as innovative, family friendly and inclusive as well as a steadfast dedication to deliver the very best experience to their customers, clients and staff.

Benefits:

  • Great salary on offer for 4+ years
  • Wide array of projects in the sector
  • You’re always going to be busy a sense of daily achievement
  • Learn from some of the best in sector… this is also a development opportunity


So if this sounds like you and the opportunity you're seeking... Apply:

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Business Manager – Property, Construction and Engineering

  • Advance your career with Stellar

  • Lead our professional team

  • Enhance our business and positive, progressive culture

About Stellar:
Being the best isn’t everything, a WILL to is.
Here at Stellar we have a genuine desire to be the best at what we do and a relentless commitment to provide our clients and candidates exceptional service.  This experience reflects our great culture where our likeminded staff are nurtured to reach and exceed their potential.  Our vision is to be the number 1 choice for our customers, job seekers and our staff.
When you join Stellar, you aren’t just joining a small team, we are a global company and we are growing, this is a long term career focused company with unrivalled opportunities.

About the role:
Due to our growth an opportunity has arisen for an experienced Business Manager to join the business to lead and grow our Australian East Coast Construction, Property and Engineering divisions. Reporting to the Australian General Manager, The Property, Construction and Engineering Division Manager will be a key member of the Senior Management Team.

This position is based in our Brisbane office and may involve some domestic travel.

This role is a pivotal career move for someone who is currently leading a team, managing key accounts and maximising company revenue though individual and team billings.

You will be responsible to manage and lead the current team of 6 and develop the existing and new consultants who join your team. As the business manager your will generate revenue by leading the sales strategy through strategic business development, establishing preferred supplier agreements and undertake ongoing key account management activities to maximise customer experience and revenue.

Skills and Experience:

  • Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing strategy to grow your relevant sector consistent to business objectives

  • Established an active role and oversee client account management and business development strategies to increase the companies reach and financial strength

  • The ability to provide ongoing high level training, mentoring and professional development to staff as required

  • Dedication to encourage and motivate your team to engage in continuous learning and empower them to achieve personal and company goals

  • Proven experience in leading a team to achieve company objectives and team billing targets

  • Ability to demonstrate successful personal billings

Culture:

Our market leaders choose to join Stellar because our culture is unrivalled and provides its employees with a supportive, rewarding, flexible and progressive environment.

  • $500 per year wellbeing rebate

  • Additional RDO’s and flexible working practices

  • Office catering and weekly Friday social drinks in the office

  • Clear career path with sponsored study options

  • Become an integral part of the true positive team that we are.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Highly Successful Civil Contractor | Permanent opportunity, becoming a key team member | Auckland City
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Responsible for construction contracts, QA,  H&S and assisting with site management
  • Well-established and successful civil contractor based in Auckland City
  • Remuneration guideline of $75,000

About the Company

Our client is one of the best known civil contractors in the Auckland Region. They provide a range of services to the civil construction industry and have carved out a solid reputation for a number of specialist construction methods, winning repeat business year on year.

About the Role

As the QA/Contracts Engineer you will need to have a background in Civil Construction. You will be responsible for a variety of functions, which will include assisting the project managers with site documentation, H&S, working on tenders and contract administration. You will be the link between the site teams and the office. There will be requirement for site visits, photographing assignments and reporting. This role would best suit a Civil Engineer with experience on site and wanting to move into the office.

Duties:

  • Site audits and incident investigation

  • Pre start documentation

  • Monitor and record variations

  • Complete QA info for client

  • Complete monthly claims

  • Assist with producing Quotes

  • Order materials, plant and equipment

  • Organise subcontractors and tip sites

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering (diploma, degree)

  • 10+ years’ experience in construction industry

  • Understanding of site engineering, tender preparation and QA work.

  • Solid communication skills and ability to relate to all levels within a business

Culture:

This business has a culture of developing and upskilling their employees, with heavy involvement from directors all the way down to site level. They provide autonomy at every opportunity, while also training and mentoring to allow careers continue in the right direction. It is a relaxed, informal office feel, far from the corporate world of a Tier One contractor. If you enjoy a good laugh at work and being involved in a successful team then this is the role.

Benefits:

  • Decent remuneration

  • Negotiable start and finish times

  • Involvement at the leadership table

  • Exposure to a broad variety of business functions

  • Minimum 4+ years recently performing structural design reviews for civil contracting companies on large civil/structural infrastructure projects such as tunnels/bridges/RC Structures (Note: not O&G/Mining projects)
  • Major Design & Construct project experience with Tier 1 civil contractors in Australia is preferred
  • Excellent all-round understanding and ability to manage interactions associated with design and construction of multi-disciplinary major projects
  • Superb communication skills with ability to influence, coordinate and resolve issues
  • Perth based with existing rights to live and work in Australia

Company Culture:

Working within this highly professional company is rewarding. Employees enjoy the benefits of a highly experienced management team, a terrific team environment and outstanding opportunities to work on major projects in Australia.

Benefits:

  • Perth based project location, no FIFO!
  • Enhance your career with a top tier civil contracting company
  • Lock in long term job security on a major project
  • CIRCA $150K (*dependent on experience)

JobListing.ShortDescription: COmplex projects, dynamic and highly successful team | Great culture.
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Busy North Island-based contractor with significant reputation in the NZ market

  • Highly successful team, taking on the most interesting and challenging projects

  • Great package on offer if you can bring the skills … and the attitude.

Our client is a leading contractor providing a range of services to a great number of clients across the North Island. Due to a growing number of projects, they are now considering applications for a Civil Engineer to join them as a Project Manager. You will be joining a high-performing and project-delivering contractor. They reward their staff well with an attactive remuneration package, as well as the opportunity to add value at senior management level. Although the occasional Saturday is involved, management are most eager for the lights to be switched off on a Friday afternoon.

Overview:

This role requires a candidate with an extensive background in civil construction, with particular experience in Heavy Industrial projects where significant problem-solving and planning is required. They are ideally looking for a degree-qualified candidate with close to 10years' experience, someone with plenty of hands-on site knowledge and plenty of exposure to the paperwork and design/planning aspects of project management. They’re looking for a go-getting thinker, someone wanting to take the next step and gain further responsibility. You will be given a great deal of autonomy in this role so a motivated self-starter will do well.

Reporting to the Operations Manager, key responsibilities will include:

  • Project Management, Project Delivery.

  • Ensuring compliance with quality, environmental, company policies and procedures.

  • Contract administration (financials included); coordinating and the delivery of contracts

  • Pricing of projects and ensuring delivery to the highest standards

  • Supervision of sub-contractors and customer relationship management

Minimum requirements:

  • 10years’ Project engineering/management experience in civil construction, ideally within the NZ market

  • Degree qualified in Civil Engineering and with relevant training

  • Proven ability to deliver on large variety of projects (value of c. $1m-$10m)

  • Experience in design work is desirable

  • Excellent computer literacy and reporting skills

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below, or email your CV quoting reference number MD22183 to the email address listed.

Contact: Maurice Deevy
Phone: +64 99691022
Email: maurice@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Long established, proven PQS firm based in Christchurch

This well regarded and time tested professional quantity surveying consultancy is currently looking for an addition to their team offering an exceptional and exciting opportunity for you to progress in your career, hone your skills, and align yourself with a very successful firm and long term employer.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Lead role on greenfield LNG Project. Dynamic Owners Team. Full project involvement, from pre-FEED to Operations
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
LNG Project Director

  • Lead role on greenfield LNG Project
  • Dynamic Owner’s Team
  • Full project involvement, from pre-FEED to Operations

About the Company:
A leading diversified resources organisation with over 50,000 employees. The organisation is structured to ensure a flat hierarchy, direct access to the board and quick, dynamic decisions. It is renowned for developing, building, owning and operating projects throughout the energy supply chain.


About the Role:
Steer the project through all project phases and ultimately to a successful completion; ensure the safe and on-time completion of the LNG Plant and associated facilities.


Duties:

  • Manage and coordinator progress of deliverables through all phases
  • Lead and ensure the performance of the technical team
  • Establish project plans and schedules that underpin deliverables
  • Manage and implement safe work systems
  • Liaise and coordinate with the EPC contractor
  • Commission and Start up the Plant
  • Manage hand over to operations

Skills & Experience:

  • Degree-qualified Engineer
  • End-to-end management of at least one LNG plant from pre-FEED to Operations
  • Proven experience of leading projects $1Bn+
  • A ‘doer’ mentality, able embrace change and proactively deal with challenges
  • Values and selects skills and knowledge required to balance teams
  • Geographically mobile; the position is initially based in SE Asia. It will relocate at FEED award and at construction
  • Flexible to facilitate meetings/conference calls across global time zones.

Culture:
People enjoy working for this company for the involvement in this landmark Mega project. Structure is flat and internal decisions are quick.
 

Benefits:
Attractive remuneration package
 

How to Apply:
Click APPLY to register your interest.

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
Recruitment Resourcer – Stellar Building & Construction

• Opportunity to start your #aStellarCareer
• Learn, Develop and Grow with the industries best
• Contribute to the positive, fun and progressive culture

About Stellar:
Being the best isn’t everything, a WILL to is.
Here at Stellar we have a genuine desire to be the best at what we do and a relentless commitment to provide our clients and candidates exceptional service. This experience reflects our great culture where our likeminded staff are nurtured to reach and exceed their potential. Our vision is to be the number 1 choice for our customers, job seekers and our staff.

About the role:
Due to continued success and internal promotions, this pivotal and highly rewarding position is now immediately available for a Resourcer to join our Brisbane team to support our expanding and experienced Building and Construction Team.

Duties:
• Source, screen, interview and reference check the industries best candidates
• Collaborate with the principal consultant to grow our candidate database
• Build your professional network within the building and construction sector
• Take charge of recruitment drives and database coding
Skills and Experience:
• Confidence communicating via phone and email with a strong attention to detail
• Previous experience within an administration or customer service focused role
• Have the drive to succeed and develop your career
• Be focused and strive to achieve KPI’s

Culture:
Our market leaders choose to join Stellar because our culture is unrivalled and provides its employees with a supportive, rewarding, flexible and progressive environment.
• $500 per year wellbeing rebate
• Additional RDO’s and flexible working practices
• Office catering and weekly Friday social drinks in the office
• Clear career path with sponsored study options
• Become an integral part of the true positive team that we are.


A resourcing role with Stellar is the blueprint to your recruitment career

07 3009 9614 or email Kiara.s@stellarrecruitment.com.au

JobListing.ShortDescription: Long established, proven PQS firm based in Christchurch
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Genuine Career Progression
• Renowned Company in Commercial and Government Projects
• Rewarding Remuneration Package + Bonus

About the Company:

Due to increased steady growth over the last year, this very successful PQS firm is looking for a strong Quantity Surveyor of 3 years + experience who is looking for an opportunity to develop in a fun and dynamic environment. This PQS firm has a well-established local brand, and specialises in project solutions from concept to completion. Emphasis is placed on challenging the norm, where promotion of an entrepreneurial culture is valued and rewarded accordingly. This successful organisation leads by example and are unwavering in their push to challenge the status quo.

About the Role:

Within your role as a Quantity Surveyor, you will collaborate closely with a Senior Manager on the initial stages of contract acquisition. Your reporting lines are direct to the Senior Manager, although this role is autonomous in the sense of full ownership over projects. You will have the opportunity to be involved in some of their largest projects across the business.

Responsibilities:

• Drive the successful delivery of medium to large commercial projects
• Manage and build strong, long-term relationships with partners and customers
• Support a number of key projects at once

The ideal candidate will have:

• Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Quantity Surveyor
• New Zealand based experience
• A degree or diploma in Quantity Surveying
• Demonstrated business partnering abilities
• Display a genuine interest in career development and team leadership
• PQS experience advantageous

Culture:

This PQS firm has developed a strong internal culture of team work, collaboration and a sense of ‘family’ among their valued employees. In their words the solution is simple, it's about people, only great people make great teams. They believe the best results are achieved not only by what you do, but by doing them better than everyone else. The organisation fosters an environment of high performers and high achievers that are handpicked and share the same understanding of success, high performance and enjoyment.

How to Apply:

If you are looking for long term career prospects, an excellent remuneration package and the opportunity to be an integral team member for the acquisition and involvement of some of New Zealand’s most exciting and challenging projects, please contact Alisha for a confidential discussion.

JobListing.ShortDescription: Asset Manager Roads and Highways, 5+ year project, based in Waikato, global company with family values - Call Adam 09 969 1024
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Leading infrastructure and services powerhouse with a global footprint
  • Family friendly culture that promotes work / life balance
  • Take ownership of your career with a clear development plan
  • Salary circa $120,000 p.a. plus vehicle

About the Company:
Stellar Recruitment has partnered with a multi-disciplined infrastructure and services company with an enviable track record of delivering projects across the globe with particular expertise in transport construction, infrastructure services, airports and industrial construction. Although they have 74,000 employees worldwide and a presence in 15 countries across the globe, they still maintain family values and promote a work life balance across their entire operation.

About the role:
This opportunity is for someone who is highly motivated to deliver quality road maintenance projects for the communities of the Waikato region to ensure the safety and efficiency of the network. We are looking for someone to take ownership of their ‘network’, their team and who has experience in State Highway Asset management and a focus on planning and strategy. Based in Hamilton or Paeroa, you won’t have to move to Auckland and experience the increased cost of living.

Duties:

  • Develop and deliver the Forward Works Programme
  • Report directly to National Asset Manager
  • Manage the Asset Engineers and broader team
  • Liaise with the public through effective communication

Skills & Experience:

  • 5 years’ experience State Highway Asset management
  • Experience in NZTA Capital / Maintenance Annual Funding Plan processes
  • Asset management knowledge including NZS 3910 : 2013 and CCA
  • Steadfast commitment to Health & Safety
  • Effective communication skills and customer service experience

Culture:
Although they have a global footprint, their New Zealand team is a close knit family with an adherence to getting everyone home safely after putting in a hard day’s work. They believe in family values and ensuring a healthy work / life balance. They also believe in offering their employees careers, not just a job and as such, provide clear career development plans.

Benefits:

  • Attractive $120,000 salary plus vehicle
  • Stable employment – project is 5+ years
  • Become an integral member of the community
  • Clearly defined career development plan
  • Family culture that promotes work / life balance
  • Based in Hamilton or Paeroa

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
International Top Tier consultancy
• Innovative and passionate team
• Above market salary

About the Company:
An International top tier consultancy, comprising of offices New Zealand wide, that brings a wealth of overseas and local experience in making this consultancy the leaders in infrastructure covering transport, water, environmental, resources and much more.

About the Role:
With their solid foundation and reputation bolstered by some senior acquisitions and continued success in winning work this consultancy is looking for a Senior Bridge Engineer for their Auckland branch to cover all aspects of Bridge design from Bid to project delivery.

Duties:

• Detailed Seismic design using New Zealand design codes
• Strong rapport building skills, and ability to work and interact with clients
• liaise with Draughters, Technicians and mentor Junior team members


Skills & Experience:

• Degree level in Engineering in line with the Washington Accord
• 6 years + detailed seismic design experience using New Zealand design codes
• CPENG or working towards

Culture:

Leading from the top without putting this lightly this established consultancy has developed and rejuvenated their culture into an environment of excellence. Colleagues are united towards a common goal to achieve excellence combined with fresh innovative thinking that puts emphasis on a work hard play hard culture.

Benefits:

• International consultancy driven by excellence
• An environment that puts their colleagues first and number one priority
• Support and guidance from experienced local and international team members

JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Long Term Position with a Stable Iron Ore Producer
  • 2/1 Roster FIFO from Perth
  • Attractive Hourly Rate

About the Company:

Our Client is well established Pilbara based Iron Ore producer, with a long-term life of mine. They have several expansion projects that will ensure stable and ongoing employment.

About the Role:

You will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of large mining equipment. This will include break downs and planned maintenance to ensure the equipment is sustaining a high level of availability.

Requirements:

  • Cert III - Heavy Diesel Fitter Trade
  • Current HR Licence
  • Ability to pass a medical and drug & alcohol screen
  • West Australian Mining Experience (Essential)
  • Experience working with electric drive dump trucks

Skills & Experience:

  • Exposure to maintenance and repairs of either 930E or MT4400 dump trucks
  • Experience working with large excavators or shovels (300t minimum)
  • Strong technical ability and a good attitude
  • 5+ years’ maintenance experience in WA mining
  • Proven track record and current work references

Culture:

The team culture is based around a positive attitude, and a safe and hard working environment.

Benefits:

  • An attractive hourly rate
  • A long term opportunity

JobListing.ShortDescription: Incredible opportunity for someone to work with a successful locally owned and operated foundations expert
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Rewarding projects
• Successful locally owned and operated construction company
• Excellent remuneration package + phone + laptop

About the company:

We are seeking a driven senior Site Forman or Project Manager to join this successful construction company in Christchurch. This organisation will provide you with a solid foundation of support from an experienced, qualified and knowledgeable team. This organisation specialises in residential and light commercial foundations. Being locally owned and operated, this company has developed a great working culture that is humble, hardworking and professional.

About the role:

This career opportunity would provide you with exposure to liaise direct to clients, stakeholders and consultancies, running large projects start to finish. Full autonomy in this role is given with the right person granted control to oversee quality, time and budget aspects of project management. Some on the tool work will be required on occasion. Having concrete/ foundation experience would be advantageous.

Ideally you will have experience in:

• Organisation of staff and contractors
• Running multiple sites
• Effective communication with geo tech’s and council to ensure correct site preparation
• Solid understanding of foundations standards and practice adherences
• Senior site supervision experience
• Produced projects to a very high level
• New Zealand construction experience

About you:

You are an experienced Project Manager or senior Site Forman who is driven, motivated and only accepts the highest of standards in your work. You are effectively able to manage a diverse range of challenges and timelines with the support of a good team. In return for this, you will be rewarded with aligning you career to a successful construction company with opportunity to be allocated new projects that are currently in the works. This is a genuine opportunity for long-term career progression where you can utilise your experience in commercial build project management.

If you are looking for long term career prospects and the opportunity to be an integral team member for a well-established organisation. Please contact Alisha via email or phone. Otherwise you can express your interest by applying today.

Consultant: Alisha Murdoch
Phone: 03 9742445
Email: alisha.m@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

JobListing.ShortDescription: 7 Month Contract role / IMMED START Reqd! / Must have 3-5 years exp with civil contractors / Initially Perth based, then 3/1 FIFO / CIRCA $60+super/hr
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Contract Role Until Dec 2016
  • New Minesite Project, Perth/FIFO 3/1
  • $60/hr + Super, IMMED START!!

About the Company:

Our client is a highly regarded national civil contractor that has recently won a new mine site construction project. Their business has a terrific reputation for delivering high quality concrete and earthworks projects on schedule and under budget. 

About the Role:

As Project Engineer (Concrete) you will be employed on contract basis initially in Perth before mobilizing to site on a 3/1 FIFO roster until the end of December 2016. You will report to the Construction Manager as part of a team that will plan and deliver a large concrete foundation for a minesite development. You will be responsible for on-site quality assurance, planning and programming of site activities, and reporting and tracking progress.

Skills, Experience & Requirements:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Civil Engineering
  • 3-5 years’ post graduate experience in Australia for civil contractors overseeing large concrete pours for remote resource sector projects
  • Excellent all-round communication skills
  • IMMEDIATELY available and currently based in Perth
  • Existing rights to live and work in Australia

Company Culture:

Working within this highly professional company is rewarding. Employees enjoy the benefits of a highly experienced management team, a terrific team environment and outstanding opportunities to work on major projects in Australia.

Benefits:

  • Job security for the rest of 2016
  • Enhance your career with a civil contracting icon
  • CIRCA $60/hr + super (dependent on experience)

The team at Stellar Workforce would like to hear from experienced Coal CAT Truck Operators who hold RII’s for the following machinery:

JobListing.ShortDescription: Residentially Based in New Zealand | Engaging and Supportive Team Environments | Learn to Ski and Snowboard in you weekends!
JobListing.JobFullDescription:
• Are you a qualified Heavy Diesel Mechanic with strong Truck and/or Equipment exposure?
• Do you have strong visual and computerised diagnostic exposure?
• Are you sick of being treated like just another number?
• Want to learn to ski and snow board in your weekends?


Due to continued growth, some exciting, progressive roles have become available for Truck Mechanics to align with one of the market leading companies operating in New Zealand. You will be responsible the planned and reactive maintenance, servicing and diagnostics of many heavy transport units, working within a rapidly expanding workshop with a team of like-minded technicians. Representing some of the most respected brands within New Zealand and internationally, safety standards second to none and an ever expanding workload, there is no better time to look at making the move.

You will need the following:
• Trade Qualified and at least 3 years’ experience within a heavy transport environment.
• Proven exposure in diagnostic equipment with solid fault finding abilities.
• Exposure to a range of heavy transport brands or a solid background specializing.
• Strong self-starter and a desire to grow and progress career.
• Solid understanding of how to be part of an efficient and “well oiled” team, all working toward a common goal.
• Sole charge or field service experience would be advantageous.
• Ability to relocate to New Zealand


ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED FOR THE RIGHT CANDIDATES


To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as shift/roster patterns, location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you could be working on, or for info on the opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.
